elements.title: Akron Baptist Temple (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Akron Baptist Temple (pictured) once featured 6-foot-tall (1.8 m) red lettering that flashed?

elements.title: Jack Ferver (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although some casting directors found Jack Ferver difficult to believe as an 18-year-old, Ferver would later portray Little Lad in a Starburst advertisement?

elements.title: Fuente de la República (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the idea for the Fuente de la República arose after Manuel Felguérez suggested a fountain to accompany his newly inaugurated Puerta 1808 to the mayor of Mexico City?

elements.title: Daniel Camargo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in his early career, Daniel Camargo was cast to dance a lead role at the opening night of Don Quixote at Stuttgart Ballet, over the principal dancers?

elements.title: The Scent of Joseph's Shirt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Scent of Joseph's Shirt was said by Iranian director and screenwriter Ebrahim Hatamikia to reflect his perception of waiting for Imam Mahdi?

elements.title: Ruslana Pysanka (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ruslana Pysanka, who hosted a Ukrainian television program together with Volodymyr Zelenskyy from 2008, died as a refugee in Germany?

elements.title: Highway 51 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Highway 51", the closing track on Bob Dylan's debut album, incorporated elements from earlier songs by Curtis Jones, Tommy McClennan, and the Everly Brothers?

elements.title: Mary Getui (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kenyan theologian Mary Getui was named a Moran of the Burning Spear?
